channel.title: I/o?
channel.description: I have questions because its seems all java is around I/O's, i have no idea what is an I/O: what is a byte? is it I/O? what can i use byte for? what is an outstream? instream? where can i use them? is that I/O? what is those flush(),size(),write,writeByte,writeDouble,writeInt,writeWordBigEndianA? is that writeWordBigEndianA is a java method or is it an rsps method? For example: outStream.writeWord(1688); what is that doing? outStream.writeDWord(wearAmount); what is that doing? outStream.writeByte(targetSlot); what is that doing? outStream.createFrame(34); what is that doing? Thank you for help and if all of this ^ ^ is I/O please write that all of this is I/O, [b]i dont even know what an I/O do[/b]. lol

item.title: I/o?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

What the flushOutStream() function does is it writes data to a relaying butter then sets the currentOffSet index back to 0 so it can continue writing again.

item.title: I/o?
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

IO stands for Input/Output. With IO you can read or write bytes, shorts, int or longs from or to streams. A (data)stream is a connection to a file or a (networking) socket.

A byte is a primitive data type that is made up of 8 bits. A short is 16 bits, an integer is 32 bits and a long is 64 bits.

Java has a lot of classes to use IO. For example a FileInputStream is an IO class to read from a file. With FileOutputStream you can write to a file.

The methods you posted are methods that write to a buffer in the same way OutputStreams writes to a stream. After you completed the data packet (a message over network) you write the buffer using the flush() method. (note that these methods are from the RSPS, and not from the Java api)

To explain endianness, please read this.

The A in writeBigEndianA is a special data type in the Runescape client.

Read full topic

item.title: I/o?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I have questions because its seems all java is around I/O’s, i have no idea what is an I/O:
what is a byte? is it I/O? what can i use byte for?
what is an outstream? instream? where can i use them? is that I/O?
what is those flush(),size(),write,writeByte,writeDouble,writeInt,writeWordBigEndianA?
is that writeWordBigEndianA is a java method or is it an rsps method?
For example:
outStream.writeWord(1688); what is that doing?
outStream.writeDWord(wearAmount); what is that doing?
outStream.writeByte(targetSlot); what is that doing?
outStream.createFrame(34); what is that doing?
Thank you for help and if all of this ^ ^ is I/O please write that all of this is I/O, i dont even know what an I/O do. lol

Read full topic
